Package hrps.boundary

Class RoomUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • hrps.boundary.RoomUI
  • public class RoomUI
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used for displaying UI for creating and finding preferred rooms (based on room type, bed type, room facing direction, smoking/non-smoking), getting and updating room details. There are also functions to generate the report for the rooms such as room occupancy report by room type, and display all rooms under each status.
    Author:
    An Ruyi

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static RoomUI getInstance()
        Get the UI instance, or create new one if no UI was instantiated. This helps prevent multiple instantiations of UI which is unnecessary.
        Returns:
        The singleton RoomUI instance ready to be used to call methods of RoomUI class.

        Starts the UI for room-related operations.

        Deals with interaction with user on maintaining rooms and finishing maintenance of rooms.

      • getMaintenanceOption

        private int getMaintenanceOption()
        Iteratively asks for a choice until a legal choice for maintenance option is keyed in.
        Returns:
        A legal choice of the user for room maintenance.

        private void findPreferredRoomUI()
        Deals with user interaction on finding a list of rooms that are preferred by the user.

      • checkForRoomDetail

        private void checkForRoomDetail()
        Deals with user interaction on finding the detail of a specific room.

      • checkRoomStatus

        private void checkRoomStatus()
        Deals with user interaction on finding the status of a room via 3 different methods. 1) Room number 2) Guest name 3) Room type

      • checkRoomStatusByRoomType

        private void checkRoomStatusByRoomType()
                                throws InvalidRoomTypeException
        Deals with user interaction on finding the status of a room via room number.
        Throws:
        InvalidRoomTypeException - if the room type entered by the user is invalid.

      • checkRoomStatusByGuestContact

        private void checkRoomStatusByGuestContact()
        Check if a room is associated to a guest with the entered guest contact.

      • checkRoomStatusByNumber

        private void checkRoomStatusByNumber()
                              throws HRPSException
        Deals with user interaction on finding the status of a room via room number.
        Throws:
        HRPSException - if the room number entered by the user is invalid.

      • updateRoomByRoomNumber

        private void updateRoomByRoomNumber()
        Find a room by room number. If no such room exists, display a error message. If such room exists, display the UI for updating details of that room.

      • createRooms

        private void createRooms()
        Reads the room information from the text file if the room list has not been loaded. It is not available for the user to manually call this method.

      • displayMainRoomUIOptions

        private void displayMainRoomUIOptions()
        Displays the UI options on the room management menu.

      • getValidRoomTypeInput

        private java.lang.String getValidRoomTypeInput()
        Asks the user to iteratively input a room type until a valid room type is entered or 'CANCEL" is entered.
        Returns:
        a legal room type from the user.

      • getValidRoomBedTypeInput

        private java.lang.String getValidRoomBedTypeInput()
        Asks the user to iteratively input a room type until a valid room bed type is entered or 'CANCEL" is entered.
        Returns:
        a legal room bed type from the user.

      • getValidRoomFacingInput

        private java.lang.String getValidRoomFacingInput()
        Asks the user to iteratively input a room facing until a valid room type is entered or 'CANCEL" is entered.
        Returns:
        a legal room facing from the user.

      • findRoomBasedOnPreference

        java.util.List<Room> findRoomBasedOnPreference()
        Find
        Returns:
        A list of room that the users prefers

      • scanForValidRoomStatusInput

        private java.lang.String scanForValidRoomStatusInput​(java.lang.String roomStatus)
        Check if the specified String is a valid RoomStatus (ignore case), if it is then return it. If the String is not a valid RoomStatus, iteratively ask for user to enter a valid RoomStatus string.
        Parameters:
        roomStatus - The specified String.
        Returns:
        A valid RoomStatus string

      • scanForValidRoomRateInput

        private double scanForValidRoomRateInput()
        Iteratively asks for user input until a valid room room rate input is entered
        Returns:
        a valid room rate

      • updateRoom

        private void updateRoom​(Room targetRoom)
        Display the UI to update the room details for the given room.
        Parameters:
        targetRoom - the room that is to be updated
